summary: This is a proposal from CACI, INC.-COMMERCIAL to the U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, for scanning and digitizing a collection of approximately 95,000 pages (40 boxes) related to the Epstein case. The document outlines technical specifications, deliverables, and corporate information for the project.
locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 86 Chambers Street, New York, NY 10007
7725 W. Reno Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73127
7725 West Reno Ave., Oklahoma City, OK 73018
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York solicited a proposal for scanning a large collection of Epstein-related documents totaling approximately 95,000 pages from 40 boxes.
The proposal outlines technical specifications including that 10% of pages require flatbed scanning, 5% require color imaging, and electronic media within the boxes will need placeholder images.
Deliverables include OCR-processed TIFF and JPG images, Concordance load files, and Bates numbering starting with 'Epstein_HCFL00000001'.
The document indicates the scanning project was part of the legal proceedings in USAO-SDNY US v. Maxwell, showing ongoing evidence processing in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Chain of custody procedures were specified to be followed, emphasizing the evidentiary importance of the document collection.
